newsitem.title: KUWAIT: UASC reports $70 mln profit in 1996.
newsitem.headline: UASC reports $70 mln profit in 1996.

text.p: The Arab world's largest shipping firm, United Arab Shipping Company (UASC), on Saturday reported a $69.95 million net profit in 1996 -- $17.2 million lower than the previous year.

A statement by the Kuwait-based firm said UASC general assembly agreed at a meeting in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, to distribute $49.5 million -- five percent of the paid up capital -- among shareholders.
UASC was formed in 1976 by Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Iraq, UAE, Qatar and Bahrain. It reported a net profit of $87.16 in 1995 and a loss of $17.29 million in 1994.
The statement put accumulated profits at $98 million at the end of 1996.
The company said it carried 425,116 containers and 1.56 tonnes of general cargo in 1996, a slight drop in container volumes but an eight percent rise in general cargo loads.
The statement reiterated that UASC would take delivery in 1998 of 10 container vessels ordered from three Japanese firms in March 1996 in a deal worth $653.77 million.
